messages.subject: Re: [unschoolingbasics] deschooling dilemna
messages.msgSnippet: There was a World of Warcraft convention here in Southern California just a few weeks ago where people from all over the world, who play together online, DID
messages.messageBody:
There was a World of Warcraft convention here in Southern California
just a few weeks ago where people from all over the world, who play
together online, DID get to meet. So that's not just a pipe dream, if
her parents will be supportive, it could happen. Too COOL! What an
amazing world we live in!

-pam

On Nov 9, 2005, at 7:40 AM, Ren Allen wrote:

> "She's playing World of Warcraft (online game) a lot and has "friends"
> she's connected with there (she says she wishes sometimes they could
> all meet)."



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: deschooling dilemna
messages.msgSnippet: She s playing World of Warcraft (online game) a lot and has friends she s connected with there (she says she wishes sometimes they could all meet). ...
messages.messageBody:
"She's playing World of Warcraft (online game) a lot and has "friends"
she's connected with there (she says she wishes sometimes they could
all meet)."

> Cool.
There are plenty of unschoolers playing that and they could conect at
the conferneces!:) My boys will be playing both World of Warcraft and
Halo2 online as soon as we get cable internet (we're waiting for the
techs to come).

I've heard from a lot of people on the various groups I'm on who play,
but most are different realms (she's already got her characters
established in one realm, and you can't connect between them).

Don't know if we'll be able to get to NM but Kathryn is planning a New
England mini conference in May that we'll DEFINITELY be at!
Jann
